meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rowdy.
meanings.sent1: The rowdinesses of the children at the party made it hard to hear.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to calm down the rowdinesses in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The rowdinesses of the puppies playing in the park brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The rowdinesses of the storm could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The rowdinesses of the fans at the concert created an electric atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Behavior characterized by noisy and unruly conduct.
meanings.sent1: The rowdinesses of the crowd at the game led to some disruptions.
meanings.sent2: The rowdinesses of the students during recess needed to be addressed by the principal.
meanings.sent3: The rowdinesses of the monkeys in the zoo kept the visitors entertained.
meanings.sent4: The rowdinesses of the wind rattled the windows all night.
meanings.sent5: The rowdinesses of the party next door kept us awake until late.
